property.name: text
property.value:
Set the location of the actor based on web page input
Convert from strings to doubles Output ports on ExpressionToToken actors have been set to type "double" (Right click on ExpressionToToken actor -> Customize -> Ports to see type info)

property.name: text
property.value:
After location is set, initialize light to zero and calculate amount of light received
RecordAssembler used to ensure light parameter is set to zero before IterateOverArray is fired

entity.name: IterateOverArray
entity.doc: Iterate a contained actor over input arrays

svg.text: Make sure there is a director here!

property.name: text
property.value:
Scale: One pixel = 1 centimeter (Room would be roughly 15 x 15 feet, 225 sq ft)
Equation: Luminous intensity on a spherical surface I = (3P) / (4*pi*r^2) where P is power in watts or lumens = Lumens per meter squared

property.name: text
property.value:
Set the location of the actor based on web page input
Convert from strings to doubles Output ports on ExpressionToToken actors have been set to type "double" (Right click on ExpressionToToken actor -> Customize -> Ports to see type info)

property.name: text
property.value: Save input array as a parameter, since it is not the same size as our data array, we cannot pass it in as an input to IterateOverArray (which iterates to the length of the shortest array input)

property.name: text
property.value: Create array of correct size FIXME: For loop in Ptolemy?

entity.name: IterateOverArray

property.name: text
property.value: Iterate over the array of lights for the current x, y location. x and y must be stored in parameters, not directly input to IterateOverArray through ports, since IterateOverArray expects arrays on input ports

property.name: text
property.value: RecordAssembler used to ensure both x and y are set before IterateOverArray is fired
